actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States relating to the eligibility of a citizen to vote in primary elections.

summary.text: Constitutional Amendment - Gives citizens of the United States, who are 18 years of age or older, the right to vote in the primary election immediately preceding any general election.

titles.title: A resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States relating to the eligibility of a citizen to vote in primary elections.
